title: Periodic waves - pitch for 1-ms and 2-ms periods

content.question: Two speakers, <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, each produce a sound wave. Speaker <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> produces a sound wave by oscillating once every <math alttext="1 times 10 raised to the negative 3 power seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>, and Speaker <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> produces a sound wave by oscillating once every <math alttext="2 times 10 raised to the negative 3 power seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math>. Which speaker produces a sound having a higher pitch, and what is a valid justification for the claim?

choices.label: Speaker <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. The frequency is greater for Speaker <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

Speaker <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. The period is longer for Speaker <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

Speaker <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. The frequency is smaller for Speaker <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

Speaker <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. The period is shorter for Speaker <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>.

content.answer: Speaker <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. The frequency is greater for Speaker <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
